location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.4847 of 1853 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, enclosing a letter received by Malet from Major Atkins Hamerton, Her Majesty's Consul and the Honourable Company's Agent in the dominions of His Highness the Imam of Muscat, dated 10 June 1853. In his letter Hamerton describes the instructions he gave to Hiskael bin Jusoph [Khojeh Hiskael], the Native Agent at Muscat, prior to his departure to Zanzibar. Hamerton comments that the Native Agent's presumption of his powers and manner of dealing with others and caused problems in Muscat.
